Donald Trump's daughter-in-law says Kamala Harris polls as bad as Biden
content: "Millions of Americans came out in those primaries and voted for Joe Biden to be their nominee on the Democrat side. If they decide right here in the 11th hour to plug somebody else in, and it's not Kamala Harris, I can't think of a bigger assault to our democratic process than doing just that. But let's see what they do. Regardless if it's Joe Biden [or] Kamala Harris, Donald Trump's polls show us right now that the American people are behind him," Lara Trump told Fox News.
summary: "Millions of Americans came out in those primaries and voted for Joe Biden to be their nominee on the Democrat side. If they decide right here in the 11th hour to plug somebody else in, and it's not Kamala Harris, I can't think of a bigger assault to our democratic process than doing just that. But let's see what they do. Regardless if it's Joe Biden [or] Kamala Harris, Donald Trump's polls show us right now that the American people are behind him," Lara Trump told Fox News.

title: 'Far-right seen winning 34% of vote in round 1 of France polls'
content: Marine Le Pen's National Rally (RN) led the first round of France's parliamentary elections with about 34% of the vote. President Macron's Together alliance secured 20.5%-23%, while the New Popular Front got around 29%. The final outcome hinges on next week's run-off and political alliances in France's 577 constituencies. Voter turnout was nearly 60%. Le Pen seeks an RN majority to form a government, while Macron urges voters to prevent the far-right from taking office.
summary: Marine Le Pen's National Rally (RN) led the first round of France's parliamentary elections with about 34% of the vote. President Macron's Together alliance secured 20.5%-23%, while the New Popular Front got around 29%. The final outcome hinges on next week's run-off and political alliances in France's 577 constituencies. Voter turnout was nearly 60%. Le Pen seeks an RN majority to form a government, while Macron urges voters to prevent the far-right from taking office.

Biden using teleprompter won't be enough, says Scaramucci
content: New York Times which also called Biden to opt out of the contest noted the stark differences between the two Bidens. Joe Biden Two, with the help of a teleprompter, is enthusiastic and forceful, clear and concise on his position on abortion, immigration, taxes and race. "Joe Biden Two was clear about Mr. Trump’s threat to democracy. Joe Biden One left viewers scratching their heads about the topic that the president has long said motivated his run in 2020," NYT observed.
summary: New York Times which also called Biden to opt out of the contest noted the stark differences between the two Bidens. title: This historian predicted 9/10 election results correctly. On Biden, he says..
content: Historian Allan Lichtman is credited to have predicted 9 out of 10 election results correctly. Amid clamors for replacing Joe Biden as the Democrat's presidential candidate, he said it could cost the Democrat the 2024 election. He said it will be a huge mistake as those who are asking Biden to bow out of the contest are not doctors and they do not know whether Biden is capable of continuing another term or not. "This is foolhardy nonsense," the American University historian said on CNN.
summary: Historian Allan Lichtman is credited to have predicted 9 out of 10 election results correctly. Amid clamors for replacing Joe Biden as the Democrat's presidential candidate, he said it could cost the Democrat the 2024 election. He said it will be a huge mistake as those who are asking Biden to bow out of the contest are not doctors and they do not know whether Biden is capable of continuing another term or not. "This is foolhardy nonsense," the American University historian said on CNN.

title: Pakistan woman leader's video viral: 'Why don't you make eye contact'
content: "My party leaders have taught me to speak looking into the eyes. I can't continue speaking if you avoid eye contact like this. Wear your glasses, sir," Zartaj Gul told Speaker Ayaz Sadiq. "I am a leader. I have got 1.5 lakh votes. If you don't listen to me, I will not be able to speak to you," Zartaj Gul said.
summary: "My party leaders have taught me to speak looking into the eyes. I can't continue speaking if you avoid eye contact like this. Wear your glasses, sir," Zartaj Gul told Speaker Ayaz Sadiq. "I am a leader. I have got 1.5 lakh votes. If you don't listen to me, I will not be able to speak to you," Zartaj Gul said.

title: Pride March, events could be targets of violence, warns NYPD
content: The New York Police Department's Intel Bureau warned that the weekend's Pride March and other Pride events could be targets for violence. "LGBTQIA+ community remains a high priority target for violent extremists and malicious actors across the ideological spectrum, necessitating elevated vigilance during the Pride March and the other Pride-related events across New York City," according to the NYPD.
summary: The New York Police Department's Intel Bureau warned that the weekend's Pride March and other Pride events could be targets for violence. "LGBTQIA+ community remains a high priority target for violent extremists and malicious actors across the ideological spectrum, necessitating elevated vigilance during the Pride March and the other Pride-related events across New York City," according to the NYPD.

title: Not the same person I married: Why Jill Biden's ex-husband is livid
content: Jill Biden's former husband Bill Stevenson who once called Joe Biden liar for stealing his anecdote back in the time when Jill was still married to Bill said he can't recognize today's Jill who is so adamant on pushing Joe Biden to the presidential contest. Bill said he saw Jill grew and was very proud of her but cannot support her defending a failing Joe.
summary: Jill Biden's former husband Bill Stevenson who once called Joe Biden liar for stealing his anecdote back in the time when Jill was still married to Bill said he can't recognize today's Jill who is so adamant on pushing Joe Biden to the presidential contest. Bill said he saw Jill grew and was very proud of her but cannot support her defending a failing Joe.

title: Video of South Asian boy shot and killed by NYPD released
content: A 13-year-old was shot and killed by a police officer in Utica after a foot chase Friday night. The bodycam video of the shocking incident has now been released. Nyah Mway, a Burmese refugee, was one of the two juveniles stopped by the Utica Police Department's crime prevention unit at 10.18 pm Friday. As they were stopped, the 13-year-old ran and displayed a pellet gun, the police said. Then he was fatally shot by the police.
summary: A 13-year-old was shot and killed by a police officer in Utica after a foot chase Friday night. The bodycam video of the shocking incident has now been released. Nyah Mway, a Burmese refugee, was one of the two juveniles stopped by the Utica Police Department's crime prevention unit at 10.18 pm Friday. As they were stopped, the 13-year-old ran and displayed a pellet gun, the police said. Then he was fatally shot by the police.

title: 'Why Prince Harry? Shocking, he's privileged': War hero's mother objects to award
content: "There are recipients that are far more fitting. There are individuals working in the veteran community that are doing tremendous things to assist veterans. These individuals do not have the money, resources, connections of privilege that Prince harry has. I feel that those types of individuals should be recognized," Pat Tillman's mother said objecting to Prince Harry getting the award named after her son.
summary: "There are recipients that are far more fitting. There are individuals working in the veteran community that are doing tremendous things to assist veterans. These individuals do not have the money, resources, connections of privilege that Prince harry has. I feel that those types of individuals should be recognized," Pat Tillman's mother said objecting to Prince Harry getting the award named after her son.

title: Biden operates fine between 10-4; debate was too late: Aides
content: White House aides have now claimed that there are two forms of Joe Biden and the debate night saw the version prone to gaffes. Biden functions fine between 10 am to 4 pm and the debate night was a disaster because it started at 9 pm, they said as Democrats are now gathering all possible excuses to justify Biden's performance and stall the clamor for Biden opting out.
summary: White House aides have now claimed that there are two forms of Joe Biden and the debate night saw the version prone to gaffes. Biden functions fine between 10 am to 4 pm and the debate night was a disaster because it started at 9 pm, they said as Democrats are now gathering all possible excuses to justify Biden's performance and stall the clamor for Biden opting out.

title: 'You're an old man now': Longtime friend urges Joe Biden to withdraw from US Presidential race
'Some mullahs are ... ': Human rights body condemns clerics for promoting 'misogynistic videos' in Pakistan
content: HRCP condemns misogynistic videos on social media, advocating for girls' education and women's rights. Urgent state intervention is required to combat hate speech and promote respect for women in Pakistan. "The Human Rights Commission of Pakistan (HRCP) has strongly condemned some videos posted on social media in which some right-wing mullahs have appealed to parents to withdraw their girls from school, saying that schools are Education promotes 'obscenity'", it said in a post on X.
summary: HRCP condemns misogynistic videos on social media, advocating for girls' education and women's rights. Urgent state intervention is required to combat hate speech and promote respect for women in Pakistan. "The Human Rights Commission of Pakistan (HRCP) has strongly condemned some videos posted on social media in which some right-wing mullahs have appealed to parents to withdraw their girls from school, saying that schools are Education promotes 'obscenity'", it said in a post on X.

title: Who is Jordan Bardella, France's far-right leader eyeing PM post
content: Jordan Bardella, 28, and Marine Le Pen are vying for victory in France's snap parliamentary election called by President Macron after a defeat in the European elections. Bardella aims for a parliamentary majority, promising to reduce undocumented migration, boost purchasing power, and reform education. The RN has rebranded, distancing from past controversies to appeal to moderate voters.
summary: Jordan Bardella, 28, and Marine Le Pen are vying for victory in France's snap parliamentary election called by President Macron after a defeat in the European elections. Bardella aims for a parliamentary majority, promising to reduce undocumented migration, boost purchasing power, and reform education. The RN has rebranded, distancing from past controversies to appeal to moderate voters.
